title: 105_hr3241
content: The "Charitable Giving Partnership Act" may be cited as the short title. Eligible activities are outlined in the act. Section 105(a) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to allow payment to a State to supplant general revenue losses incurred under a State law providing a credit against State income tax for contributions to certain tax-exempt organizations. The text chunk discusses the criteria for organizations to qualify for tax-exempt status under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including being organized in the US or a qualified state, filing returns under section 6033, and providing services to individuals in need. The text chunk outlines criteria for organizations to qualify for tax-exempt status, including providing services to individuals in need with limited administrative expenditures. The text outlines criteria for organizations to qualify for tax-exempt status, including restrictions on litigation, voter registration, and political organizing. SEC. 3. USE OF STATE AMOUNTS FOR NONENTITLEMENT AREAS. Section 106(d) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 (42 U.S.C. 5306(d)) is amended to address the allocation of amounts for a State that remain after distribution for use under paragraph (8). The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to address the distribution of remaining amounts for a State after allocation for use under paragraph (8). This includes adjustments to subparagraphs and redesignation of paragraphs. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to allow States to use up to 20 percent of allocated amounts for a specific activity, with the remainder distributed according to the subsection. The Secretary will release funds to States meeting certain requirements. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 allows States to use up to 20 percent of allocated funds for a specific activity. States receiving funds must include a statement of proposed eligible activity and the percentage of allocation to be used for that activity.
